skill.name: deployment-pipeline-design
skill.description: Design multi-stage CI/CD pipelines with approval gates, security checks, and deployment orchestration. Use when architecting deployment workflows, setting up continuous delivery, or implementing GitOps practices.
skill.summary: Design multi-stage CI/CD pipelines with approval gates, security checks, and deployment orchestratio...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown explanations and YAML/JSON example snippets. All static findings are false positives triggered by example code patterns in documentation. No executable scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or credential handling code exists. The skill is a reference guide for CI/CD architecture patterns.

content.value_statement: Many teams deploy without clear stages or approvals and face risky releases. This skill gives proven pipeline structures and rollout strategies to improve safety and speed.
actual_capabilities: Defines standard CI/CD stages and ordering for multi-environment pipelines
Provides approval gate patterns for GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Azure Pipelines
Explains deployment strategies including rolling, blue-green, canary, and feature flags
Includes a multi-stage pipeline example with build, test, deploy, and verify steps
Outlines rollback and monitoring practices for safer releases
limitations: Provides design guidance and examples, not runnable automation scripts
Referenced assets and reference files are not included in this directory
Examples assume external tools like kubectl, trivy, and Argo Rollouts
Does not configure or manage secrets stores

use_cases.title: Multi-stage pipeline plan
use_cases.description: Create a staged CI/CD design with approvals and safety checks for production releases.

use_cases.title: Standardize deployment strategy
use_cases.description: Select rolling, blue-green, or canary strategies for consistent platform releases.

use_cases.title: Release governance guide
use_cases.description: Define approval gates and verification steps for controlled production changes.

prompt_templates.title: Starter pipeline
prompt_templates.scenario: New team needs basic CI/CD flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a simple multi-stage CI/CD pipeline for a web app with build, test, staging, approval, and production deploy.

prompt_templates.title: Approval gate design
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose approval gate patterns for GitHub Actions and Azure Pipelines, including who approves and when.

prompt_templates.title: Strategy selection
prompt_templates.scenario: Choose a rollout approach for production
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare rolling, blue-green, and canary strategies for a high-traffic API and recommend one.

prompt_templates.title: Full pipeline blueprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a full CI/CD pipeline with security scans, staging tests, approval, canary deploy, verification, and rollback.

output_examples.input: Design a CI/CD pipeline with approval and rollback for a Kubernetes service.
output: Stages: Source, Build, Test, Staging Deploy, Integration Tests, Approval, Production Deploy, Verify, Rollback
Approval: Manual gate after staging with a named approver group
Deployment: Canary rollout with stepwise traffic shifts and health checks

output_examples.input: How do I implement blue-green deployment for a database-backed application?
output: Deploy green version alongside blue with identical infrastructure
Run smoke tests against green before switching traffic
Keep blue running for instant rollback if issues arise

output_examples.input: What metrics should I track to measure deployment success?
output: Deployment frequency: how often you deploy to production
Lead time: time from code commit to production deployment
Change failure rate: percentage of deployments causing failures
Mean time to recovery: how quickly you restore service after incidents

best_practices: Fail fast with quick tests before long-running jobs
Use environment parity between staging and production
Automate rollback based on health checks and error rates
anti_patterns: Skipping approval gates for high-risk production changes
Deploying without post-deploy verification or monitoring
Using a single stage for build, test, and deploy

faq.question: What platforms does this work with?
faq.answer: The examples cover GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Azure Pipelines, and the concepts apply to most CI/CD systems.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only and does not execute or configure pipelines.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns align with common tools like Kubernetes, Argo Rollouts, and security scanners.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it is static documentation and does not access files, secrets, or networks.

faq.question: What if my pipeline fails?
faq.answer: Use the rollback and verification guidance to isolate issues and restore a stable release.

faq.question: How is this different from a template skill?
faq.answer: This focuses on architecture decisions and tradeoffs rather than providing runnable templates.
